timeline.body: You shouldn't use string concatenation when you already have a StringBuilder to use. String concatenation ends up using another StringBuilder when it generates the java bytecode. So just chain multiple `append` statements instead. ```suggestion capability -> html.append("").append(StringEscapeUtils.escapeHtml(capability)).append("")); ```
timeline.bodyHTML:
You shouldn't use string concatenation when you already have a StringBuilder to use. String concatenation ends up using another StringBuilder when it generates the java bytecode. So just chain multiple append statements instead.

Suggested change
capability -> html.append("<tr><td>" + StringEscapeUtils.escapeHtml(capability) + "</td></tr>"));
capability -> html.append("<tr><td>").append(StringEscapeUtils.escapeHtml(capability)).append("</td></tr>"));
